Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; dull cream slip; exterior: painted decoration consisting of partridges to right (chest, wing and one leg of partridge on left and body, one leg and part of second leg of partridge on right); below, zigzag pattern frieze between black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Schlotzhauer notes the weakness of Cook's group (as Cook had already done) and prefers a date of 575-550 BC. The birds are water-birds, not partridges (2013, 38).
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 35, no. 4, pl. XVIII, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.022)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 138, Nau 104, pl. 23b)
